website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive Nerf gun that makes up for the small load capacity with awesome action and long-range.
pros: Capable of firing quickly and shooting long range, up to 75 feet
Easy to load, even for youngsters
cons: Only holds 6 darts at a time, and they occasionally jam when the barrel fails to rotate

customer_reviews.title: Our new favorite Nerf guns...
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old and I have begun the Nerf battles that he keeps seeing on TV, so I had to upgrade us to a multi shot option.. We both love the two I purchased... They simply work great... (& he can actually pull this one back to arm it, so that is a bonus... Some can be a bit hard for smaller kids)... Great purchase for us... Shoots a good distance, etc... Very happy....
customer_reviews.author: SHAWN

customer_reviews.title: Consult with your significant other before buying
customer_reviews.text: Personally, as a grown man, I love this gun. I bought 2 of them so that I could war with my wife. I most likely should've consulted her before making this purchase. I may or may not of shot her a few times and was scolded as a result. Apparently, I might take games too seriously and have an issue with competition. Woops. Would I buy it again? Maybe not to shoot my wife, but definitely when we have a kid! They remind me of a better, more compact version of what I played with as a kid! Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Justin K.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not meant for adult hands.
customer_reviews.text: PRO: Had it shipped to the office with some other stuff. Boss came by for an update on a project and asked about the package. Opened it, loaded the cylinder, cocked it and handed it over. He immediately aimed at a can of compressed air and managed 2 shots out of the 6. He seemed to enjoy it so much I'm afraid to take it home now, or I at least have to buy him one of his own. CON: Whose hands does this fit, and do all Nerf pistol grips feel this way?
customer_reviews.author: Justin W. Dodson

customer_reviews.title: a variety of ages have used these guns from 2-40 and they are very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We bought 6 of these guns for each member of our family. We have already tried them out in an epic Christmas eve Nurf gun war. The purchase of 100 more darts was necessary. We took down the Christmas tree and found a few leftover darts in there too! Due to relatives coming and going, a variety of ages have used these guns from 2-40 and they are very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Hananilee

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened... It was used very lightly for about 6 days - no modifications or drops or anything, but it almost never fires properly anymore. The barrel doesn't spin when you fire, and most darts just kind of flop out of the end now. Big disappointment. The first day it was awesome - it fired nice and hard. But it slowly went downhill after that until now it's pretty much unusable. I probably just got a lemon, but it still sucks to spend money for a useless plastic gun.
customer_reviews.author: Kelso

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Was trying to decide whether to buy the Strongarm or the Disruptor and ended up with one of each. The Strongarm did not fire as effectively as the Disruptor and is prone to jamming. If it didn't jam the bullets would frequently just fall to the ground. You will be happier with the Disruptor and it is a little cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great starter Nerf gun.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter Nerf gun. If you're someone who is just getting into this hobby, you can't go wrong with the Strongarm. It has decent performance out the box and the pop out reloading mechanism is just plain cool. If you're one of those Nerfers who are taking another step and modding this gun, it is totally worth it. The performance is greatly improved from the mod. But as I said earlier, the Strongarm is already a decent gun as stock.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne C.

customer_reviews.title: Design is a bit flawed.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my nephew because it's a great looking gun, and I thought he would enjoy whole kinesthetic aspect of having a revolver that you can flip out to load up and spin. All that is great, but the problem with this gun is that if you put a dart in it that's ever-so-slightly crooked, it won't make it past the barrel before the chamber rotates, meaning it gets wedged in it, and gets bent up. The only way this toy works well is if the darts you use are 100% perfect, which way too much of a pain to deal with, so unfortunately I can't recommend this particular gun.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Sidearm
customer_reviews.text: A good, cheap, reliable gun. The only time I've seen it jam is when I'm doing something I shouldn't. If you don't push the darts all the way down their chamber, they sometimes only shoot a couple feet, but you quickly learn how to load them correctly. Doesn't shoot as far or as accurate as the Rival guns, but that also means it doesn't hit as hard. It is also a lot easier to pull back the slide. I purchased 5 of them 2 years ago and they all still work like new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this for a slightly older child
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gun for my 4 year old son for Christmas. He had been begging for a Nerf gun. He likes it but it is a little hard for him to load. I also couldn't believe how hard and fast it shoots. So just a warning. If the child may shoot the gun at people, it hurts. I would recommend this for a slightly older child.
customer_reviews.author: SaHerman

customer_reviews.title: Light usage but didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay for a short time but didn't have enough range to scare the obnoxious crows out of my fairly tall tree. Then it sat around for 8 weeks and the next time I tried it there was no air pressure... the darts just jammed. I thought about taking it apart and trying to fix it, but why? What a waste of money. EDIT Actually, it still shoots fine but only if you pull back on the cylinder when firing.
customer_reviews.author: Sturgeon

customer_reviews.title: Great joy for kids
customer_reviews.text: Just opened up package and gave it to my son. He is over the moon, can't be leave how such a simple toy can make boy so happy. I've been shot multiple times already :). Anyway, the product is great, comes with set of bullets, but expect to buy extra because they are getting lost easily. Colors bright, cannot be confused with real gun under any lighting conditions whatsoever. Bullets are very soft, fly no more than 20 feet cannot make any damage. For being extra careful I would recommend wearing goggles if more than one kid is playing and they are shooting each other - just to protect eyes. Great product, great gift for any boy 6 and up.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift I'll update after
customer_reviews.text: I gave you three stars because this isn't the nerd brand this is s knock off but I wont know if it works until Christmas day.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: So elite I dont know what to say. Meow.
customer_reviews.text: So ELITE, blasted everything. Now am the most feared nerf slinger in town. Blast blast blast blast blast. Nothing left to blast. What now is my purpose? Too elite... Fires quickly and fairly accurately. Good cat deterrent (honestly that is what I got it for, save the house plants!) Quick reloading for blasting ALL the cats. I do not condone cat blasting. Dont do it. But if you do, do it for the right reasons. (It doesnt hurt okay? Just startling... jeez lay off me)
customer_reviews.author: Chris Calaway

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate, and started to malfunction after a week!
customer_reviews.text: Apparently this is a very cheaply-made toy, because this is the second one I’ve had with the same issue. After a while, some of the foam bullets randomly won’t fire properly. They will just drop out, or go a few feet and drop. Also, I line the sights up exactly, and these foam bullets go all over the place (left, right, up, down). It’s almost impossible to hit a target ten feet away!
customer_reviews.author: David Tesch

customer_reviews.title: Good dart gun
customer_reviews.text: My 3.5 yr old asked for a dart gun for Christmas for him and daddy to play with, I bought two of these and they exceeded my expectations. He can even cock the gun himself so it makes for playing together that more fun. The darts to hurt a little when shot at close range, they have a good punch, but that doesn’t stop them.
customer_reviews.author: SLC

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: A toy is an item that is used in play, especially one designed for such use. Playing with toys can be an enjoyable means of training young children for life in society. Different materials like wood, clay, paper, and plastic are used to make toys. Many items are designed to serve as toys, but goods produced for other purposes can also be used. For instance, a small child may fold an ordinary piece of paper into an airplane shape and "fly it". Newer forms of toys include interactive digital entertainment. Some toys are produced primarily as collectors' items and are intended for display only.
customer_reviews.author: gus oropeza

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: The quality is amazing considering the price. I bought four of them for the entire family. Living in the new normal of always being home, having toy guns to shoot each other made sense! We love them. My biggest pro is the price. Second is accuracy and distance - it's impressive. Third, the revolver style chamber is a fun feature to me. The only complaint is that occasionally the ammunition gets stuck in the chamber and the toy does have a cheaper feel to it, I hope they hold up. We have had them for about two weeks now and everyone loves them. Great toy.
customer_reviews.author: andrew koerper

customer_reviews.title: Gift for Husband
customer_reviews.text: As a fun gift I got 3 of these Nerf guns for my husband (1 for him, me, and our little one) and he was so excited. It came well packaged and had a good amount of ammo. I would recommend getting the extra ammo though if buying more than one (makes battles great). Accuracy is acceptable but definitely better at close range. One thing we noticed right away is that you have to push in the ammo pretty hard (two adults struggled) to get it to work. It would be even harder for a kid. This is why we had to take away a few stars.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney D.

customer_reviews.title: Too much fun!!
customer_reviews.text: These guns are a blast! You have six rounds that you can rapid fire(hold trigger and pump the slide) or single shot. The darts do thump with some force which will get your attention (but are nothing like being hit with a paintball) so be careful with where you hit someone(avoid face shots especially if they do not have eye protection). They are surprisingly accurate for a "Nerf" gun. They have a somewhat limited accurate range of 20-30 yards for large targets and I would say maybe 10-15 yards for small targets indoors ("Outdoors with wind" would diminish the accurate range considerably.
customer_reviews.author: MDS Photos

customer_reviews.title: Gun broke after very very minimal use
customer_reviews.text: This gun was fired literally about <40 times. It now makes a horrible sound when firing darts and 4/6 of them only go 3 feet or less. This problem happened when using "slam firing". Although the gun is made for this I would recommend not doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Apartment Wars
customer_reviews.text: Some days you just really need to remind your roommates who's boss. Or to do dishes. Or just launch a surprise attack on them in the bathroom (haha, wait, don't do that.) So here is the breakdown: Pros: - So fun - Shoots fast - Fairly easy to reload Cons: - Ouch, that kind of smarts! - Where did all of those bullets go? I like this product and we are having fun with it, it might not be for those with a low pain tolerance. Be safe, have fun, buy extra ammo.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken.
customer_reviews.text: Gun arrived broken, the darts do not advance to the next round after shooting. Have to manually move the chamber, which defeats the point of the gun.
customer_reviews.author: dsharkgod

customer_reviews.title: Fun Toy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after a number of years seeing these toys and wondering how accurate they are. I am just plinking empty cans and targets in my house. It is amazingly accurate. I do not use it to play with others and never tried it outside. For fun indoor target shooting it is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Star Wars Nerf Han Solo Blaster
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, My grandson couldn't wait for Christmas to open up his Star Wars Nerf Han Solo Blaster, he put the bullets in which i bought extras...It would not project them out....The sound is awesome...If i had the box I would be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Gaynell F Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Disruptor is easier to reload since it doesn't have drop cylinder
customer_reviews.text: The drop cylinder on the Strongarm is fun to fidget with, and it looks cool - but its one more step when having to reload. The Disruptor blaster doesn't look as cool, but easier to reload which matters on the battle field :) Functionally, I prefer the Disruptor blaster. Aesthetically, I prefer the Strongarm. In the end, Function over Form wins for me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carlin

customer_reviews.title: Great Thing for Older Boys
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 grandsons and purchased 3 of these for our house. I thought just the younger boys would play with them, but even our 19 year old grandson loves ducking in and out of rooms and furniture shooting at one another. Great thing is nothing breaks. These hold up forever. I had purchased smaller ones, and then replaced with these since they hold more bullets. What fun to hear the boys laughing and having a great time!! By the way, they still play with the smaller ones as well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Henke

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: My son purchased this for my husband for Father's Day. As soon as he opened the package, he loaded the gun and began shooting. He loves it! The darts do not have a suction feature, unfortunately, but the gun is a perfect size for its purpose. My son plans to hang a picture of an annoying/frustrating person in my husband's new (coronavirus) home office, as a target for some stress-relief shooting practice between meetings!
customer_reviews.author: Linda C.

customer_reviews.title: Great gun
customer_reviews.text: I reluctantly bought this for my husband for Christmas. He had been asking for a new one a better one, than the old one he has. I say reluctantly because I am a constant target. Me and the cats. I like these darts better than the suction ones; those sting a little if they hit you just right. Bonus: they're easy to clean! A dart may have fallen into dinner while I was cooking, and now you can't even tell.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brannon

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3 for all boys ages 3, 6 and 49!!! yep Father's Day! They are great for all three! Everyone can operate them independently. They are powerful so watch out how close they are to each other. We also put the kids in safety goggle because although the guns have good accuracy the boys don't aim well. Great value. We have about 10 guns and they love these! This might be my go to gun for gifts too
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: nice toy and done exactly what the product said it ...
customer_reviews.text: came early and carefully packaged. nice toy and done exactly what the product said it would. my only problem with this product is the trigger is very hard to pull. it is a nice toy but it is too hard for my kid to use. but i would still recommend you try this out. i would say for ages 8 or up. little fingers cant pull the trigger
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for repeated shots
customer_reviews.text: They didn't make 'em this cool when we were kids! I'm no Nerf gun expert, but I love the revolver-type loading of this one -- it's so easy to pop off a bunch of shots in a row without having to stop and reload. And the gun, while sizable, is small enough to hide away under the desk when the boss comes by.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Buy
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great toy for the price! I bought for my 28 year old husband, he loves it. The pull-back lever on it is not difficult to pull back, but it does take effort. I think it may be a little hard for littles to pull back at first. Packaging came without flaws, easy to take out of the box. Would totally buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: becareful
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with these my son accidentally shot me in the eye with this nerf gun and i couldnt see right for almost 6 months . not saying the gun or toy is broken or anything, its a well made toy.Just saying becareful buy googles
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Hard to cock it....
customer_reviews.text: The kids were 6 and 7 and it was hard for them to click it back. They kept thinking they broke the gun. After about an hour of re-demonstrating, guiding their hands and forcing them to listen for the click sound... they became pros and we became running targets. Those little guns have some distance on them. Only hold a few bullets which slows down the action, but that gave us time to hide while they reloaded.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Nerf makes its fun and easy!
customer_reviews.text: Won't get in the weeds here in a long review because this Nerf Gun is what you expect out of Nerf Guns! It's Great! We have 3. Sure, it will eventually misfire like EVERY toy gun but THIS IS DUE TO WORN OUT BULLETS and not the Gun failing. Perfect gift for anyone including those who like to play indoors or just terrorize siblings.:) FYI - I do not work for any related company or get paid for any reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: I Feel Invincible Wielding This Weapon
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. I shoot my kid a lot with this. Instead of going for his 100-capacity gatling-style Nerf gun, he will typically try to beat me to this one. You can jump over the couch and accurately shoot your target easily with this gun. You can also easily run and wildy fire shots, often hitting your target with this gun. The gun is durable, does not jam (that we have seen) and is fairly light-weight. WARNING: As with all Nerf guns, the Nerf darts fired from this gun have a tendency to land all over the house and stay there, resulting in an angry wife. Please use extreme caution.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Great gun to teach your kid to aim a gun at a target and have some fun outside or inside.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these nerf guns as well of a couple other N strike styles. Its great the darts can be bought in bulk. The kids love having nerf wars with this gun. Its super accurate. Fyi... this gun fires very fast. However, to shoot a dart from this gun you have to slide the pump back. Its made so kids around 3 need help. Which means you can monitor where the kid is shooting the darts.... please not in the face ;).
customer_reviews.author: Nick Pechmann

customer_reviews.title: Very cool style and works well
customer_reviews.text: This is probably what I would consider the "standard" Nerf gun, or at least it should be. It shoots hard, has a really cool loading mechanism, and just looks and feels satisfying. I also have the Disruptor, which is supposedly a new and improved version of this Strongarm gun, but actually my experience suggests that the Strongarm is better. As best as I can tell, the Strongarm shoots harder, is more accurate, and jams less. This is one of my hardest-shooting guns. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap - this thing fires.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for a four year old girl and I regret it. I immediately made her put on eye protection when firing it because it blasts. Really. They didn't make Nerf guns like this when I was a kid. Wish I'd gotten one for myself and got her a rubber band gun or something in hindsight, but at least for the time being the activity is restricted to something she HAS to do with mom or dad for safety reasons. That's probably better anyhow.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: I shoot my wife in the butt when she's least expecting! :)
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy! I've been shooting my wife's butt whenever she walks by, it's so much fun! Just not for her though! :) I have two problems about this Nerf blaster: 1) This Nerf blaster sometimes does not cycle properly if you are shooting very fast. For example, when you are in the middle of a shootout with your kids: sometimes the first foam dart fails to exit the blaster, the blaster cycles to the next dart, and the rotating barrel jams with the first dart inside. This has gotten me shot and "killed" many times. 2) Sometimes the blaster does not get enough suction and shoots the dart only a few feet (5-6ft.)
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Boys are thrilled Santa got them these!
customer_reviews.text: Boys have been asking for Nerf guns for last 3-4 yrs. Daddy was apposed to it, one son got similar for birthday gift and both were eager to hurt each other with it. Each boy got one of these "from santa" for holidays along with 100 bullets each. They now got it out of their system and no more fights! Nice quality for decent price - always felt intimidated at the store and all the cheaper versions like this were already sold out. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: LMILAB

customer_reviews.title: Cheap knock off but they work
customer_reviews.text: Horrible packaging. What a disappointment. So glad they were for my son and not a gift. They were is cardboard packaging with the instructions rolled inside. They work fine but misfire 30% of the time. Thankfully my son is only 4 1/2 so he's not fussy. Again ugly horrible packaging like Chinese knock off. Got what I paid for and not buying them at the store. Live and learn. You'll see when you get them what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Mardi Spicer

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed. worked well only for 2 days.
customer_reviews.text: After two days only 2 darts work. the gun misfires and the dart get stuck. when it works it only launches the darts 2 -3 feet out. what a disappointment this is. i am not sure if its the gun or the darts that are broken. i looked at the darts and then feel new.
customer_reviews.author: SY

customer_reviews.title: Not the best choice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson for Christmas. I thought it would make a great gift for a young boy. It does not appear to be very accurate. I had bought a nerf target to go with this gun and even the older kids and adults have difficulty with the accuracy. The barrel keeps getting stuck when the gun is being used.
customer_reviews.author: Cape meares

customer_reviews.title: Great! Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Very good and looks more expensive than it actually is. Love that you can shoot 6 times in a row. Lots of fun. We have a 3 year old at home, this is not for his age, so he is kinda scared to shoot this cuz it’s very powerful. But he likes watching us playing it and load it for us. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Yao

customer_reviews.title: Good Gun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 6yr old who lived Nerf guns. This one was the cheaper offering that came without all the factory packaging. For me, it was well worth it as the recipient didnt care at all. He was able to get to the toys quicker and and easier than having to cut through needless plastic and cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for the holiday and they are great! We had the little 3 bullet shooters before and now we're spoiled with these. Wonderful quality for the price too. We didn't want to spend $40 on one gun when we needed two of them and these fit the bill in every way. Half the fun is grabbing the ammo around the house without getting shot.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Hays

customer_reviews.title: Fun times
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift that still works and kids play with 6 months later. Best to get a large extra supply of ammo and a Tupperware and teach the kids to clean up immediately after they play or you will find them everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Nice gun but ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this gun but I think the Disrupter is better solely due to the reloading mechanism. This Strongarm has a flip out cylinder to reload while the Disrupter does not require that. Otherwise they are the same gun for the most part. I would give this five stars if it weren't for the better reloading mechanism of the Disrupter which does deserve five stars.
customer_reviews.author: A. Figge

customer_reviews.title: Hummmmmm
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for a 7 and 3 year old. Was a bit disappointed after reading other reviews. Even the 7 year old had trouble with enough strength to "cock" these guns. The three year old...it was impossible...Guess they will grow to them.....
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Just like the original blue and orange maverick I had back in the day. Same exact size, shape, 6 shot revolver gun. Too bad there are so many bullets from nerf now though, I was at a party for my students at work and most of the bullets that look exactly the same did not shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Pham

customer_reviews.title: Great for self defense at the office
customer_reviews.text: This shoots pretty far and accurate. I'd wager that you can make most of your shots on targets at or within 30 feet without trying. Mine is mostly used for office shootouts and surprise attacks, and it works wonderfully. Straight shot down the hall, the dart hits the ground at around 80 feet or so, and close range it doesn't hurt but it's enough to surprise you quite a bit. All in all, it's been a great purchase, and has held up to a decent amount of abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not original packaging
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a nerf gun, but it did not come in Nerf packaging, and it doesn't seem to have near the air power that our other gun like it has. I'm not sure if it's even actually a Nerf gun! I got it for my nephew but was kind of embarrassed to give it to him in a plain brown box.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Webb

customer_reviews.title: It's bark is worse than it's bite
customer_reviews.text: This blaster, while it looks intimidating, is quite weak. Shooting distance is short, it jams often, and does not shoot straight. My coworkers often make fun of me because of its poor shooting abilities. I would return it if I could, but I am outside of the return window. When it shoots well, it is great...but "when" is not very frequent.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Really not what you want
customer_reviews.text: This was great for about 5 minutes then stopped working as it was supposed too. After looking, it’s obvious that the darts weren’t lining up to the pressure chamber. 1 shot out of 6 works, all the others jam, including careful adult use. I’d advise looking elsewhere for a Nerf dart gun that’s not mechanically complex.
customer_reviews.author: Endothrow

customer_reviews.title: Of Course They're Great!!
customer_reviews.text: bought these as a surprise for my bf. we bought mini omes on a whim (they only hold two bullets) lol so these are a very nice upgrade. also bought spare bullets. honestly, who could rate these poorly unless they arrived broken?? lol best toy for adults and kids alike. they were a hit! 😉
customer_reviews.author: Annie B.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Christmas gift for my boys
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for my kids (7 and almost 5 years old) for Christmas. We have had a blast with these guns! We had a discussion about safety when they got them because I can tell you from experience they do sting when shot in the face. They even like target practicing with them. The bullets they come with are not the suction type- they have a blunt end that doesn't stick to surfaces. Setting up stacks of Legos and seeing who can knock them over with the Nerf guns is one of their favorite things to do.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha K.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! It works well and is exactly as pictured. You'll have to buy the bullets to go with it though, it only comes with enough to fill it once....it's a little difficult for my 4 year old to pull it back snd reload it himself though.
customer_reviews.author: Mj

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these during Christmas and they are awesome. My kids and I have nerf wars all over the house. Word of caution: these things do shoot out with a good amount of force. Not really enough to hurt anyone, but definitely enough to break something if valuables are nearby. My 4 year old needs help to pull back the lever to make it shoot, because it does require a little bit of strength, but other tan that, these are perfect! Make sure to get plenty of ammo!
customer_reviews.author: Reesie

customer_reviews.title: Present for Son (and by default... a present for my husband)
customer_reviews.text: My husband got a set of two of these for my son for Christmas -- which of course means he really got himself a set of these for christmas.. ;) You can't go wrong with Nerf. These are the real deal, and these guns work perfectly. The bullets shoot great. We've had our fair share of problems with other Nerf and Nerf-like guns before, but this one has none of those problems. They've held up great for 5 months now and appear to be able to go much, much longer.
customer_reviews.author: SsMsP

customer_reviews.title: The ratings were great but price was so low that I had pretty ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for our grandkids and their dads for Christmas. The ratings were great but price was so low that I had pretty low expectations. They ended up being one of the hits of Christmas day. I was very impressed with the accuracy and range. It didn't occur to me when I bought them that you would actually be able to aim them. Just for the fun of it I took aim at a hanging ornament about 20' away and nailed it! Yes, my self-esteem immediately increased - as did my opinion of my Blaster. I mean my grandson's Blaster. Dang it, why didn't I get one of these for me?
customer_reviews.author: JSG

customer_reviews.title: Good gun, not motorized
customer_reviews.text: This gun is an upgrade from the maverick of yesteryear. It is mechanically identical, but the spinning cartridge feels more sturdy. Paint looks good, came packaged nicely and both of the two I bought have worked since I got them 3 months ago. The gun itself is fully manual, which is kind of not what I was expecting since it has a "rapid fire" mode. For that you hold down the trigger and slide the slider. It works very well despite not being motorized.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Accurate six shooter with the wonderful power of the nerf gun I decimated the enemy ...
customer_reviews.text: The roommate never saw what was coming! Accurate six shooter with the wonderful power of the nerf gun I decimated the enemy in the fight for the living room. We claimed the couch and pushed the front line back to the kitchen doorway.
customer_reviews.author: Kacey Mwahahaha

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for grandsons
customer_reviews.text: A Christmas gift hit for three 7-9 year old grandsons! "Battle Royal" quickly began after opening. The darts are not the main attraction as they slow the game. Design, rotating barrel, and clicking sound when fired were the attraction for our boys.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Robb

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and powerful
customer_reviews.text: My 25 year old bought this and my 20 year old daughter says it the greatest thing ever! She took to her bedroom with a vaulted ceiling and shot a spider down. If not for this fun I am sure she would have slept on the couch for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian W

customer_reviews.title: Good Nerf gun for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Gave one of these to each of my nephews for their birthday. The love it and it works well. I took an incidental dart to the neck from one, and it has some good power behind it, nothing to bad. Not a cheap shooting nerf gun tho, pretty quality.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent blaster-style revolver for only $12.
customer_reviews.text: These things are great for $12. We got two so we could goof around. My kid loves it. They're not too heavy, not too bulky, easy to load and operate, fun to shoot. I know these are used to build more realistic props in cos-play too because of the size/shape. Overall for $12 it's really fun. Can't complain. Always get more bolts/darts, you will destroy and lose them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Behavior Modification.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking everywhere for an amazing deal on being able to legally shoot my kids and this is it! It’s compact and easily hidden in coach cushions, purses, under car seats, or even down your pants. Then you just wait for your kid to say something out of line and wham click wham click wham click. 6 rounds right at that mouthy toilette licker all without reloading. I keep a spare close by in case I need an extra 6 rounds if they are being particularly vile, or if I just forgot my latte.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son for Christmas and we have so much fun with them!! They actually kinda hurt a little but not 2 bad. We have full nerf gun wars in our basement. Good luck trying to keep the house clean with the bullets all over the place
customer_reviews.author: Fhockey28

customer_reviews.title: Great range for a toy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 5y/o nephew. He's a bit on the smaller side for this gun, but when it's pre "cocked" for him he has a blast (pun not intended lol). The pressure of the darts are not harmful at all. The range at which these darts fly is pretty far. When he's sleep, the adults have so much fun with it too. We had purchased him two for him and a visiting guest/ friend. Little did we know we simultaneously purchase them for ourselves lol. Get the toy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rockin' that Prime

customer_reviews.title: Gun has some flaws
customer_reviews.text: Good concept but I gave this to my 9 year old and it seems like it is always jamming and trying to load to many darts into the barrel. The reason is that the chamber will turn even when it is half cocked so to make sure it doesn't jam you have to really make sure to fully pull the re-loader back.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Breinig

customer_reviews.title: Good distance and fun, years later still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two of these for a couple of years now. I've attacked my wife a lot with these things. Still going strong too this day (the nerf blaster) my wife on the other hand purchased a painful bow and arrow suction cup tip arrow thing that hurts like hell in retaliation for me using these. On a good note the range I get with these I can nail her in the arse and run before she can react!
customer_reviews.author: Northern Bradster

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle fun!
customer_reviews.text: A bit hesitant about getting this but, it was at the top of our 6 yr olds Christmas list. To never have played with a nerf gun before to my knowledge lol, they were able to operate and play with these immediately. Even after 6 months have passed and these are holding up and they enjoy playing with them. I did purchase additional nerf bullets for the rest of the family but, was definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Busy Bee Mommy

customer_reviews.title: They are fun and make my kids smile
customer_reviews.text: All and all these blasters are fun to use. They do misfire at times and a dart will get stuck in the barrel while the chamber tries to spin but overall the kids love to chase me around with them so I am happy it didn't cost a lot to give them some joy.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Berry

customer_reviews.title: Fun, powerful. Buy some goggles.
customer_reviews.text: Buy the kids safety goggles with this order. DID I MENTION THE GOGGLES? We bought three of these for Christmas. Being brand new to nerf guns we stayed away in the past because we just don't spend a lot on toys. We notmaly lean toward clothing and educational outdoor fun. But these are a load of fun at a great price. Makes for a fun game of capture the flag or all out battle. That said. Take one of these to the eye, as I did Christmas morning and you will be in a world of hurt. Thankfully we had 4 pair of safety goggles from a homeschool project and with those on the fun resumed.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Jams all the time, useless
customer_reviews.text: It jams all the time. See the photos. Out of several dozen attempts it shot 3-4 times on the first try. When it shoots, sometimes the range is 5-10 feet, but usually it just goes 2-3 feet. We have an old battery powered Nerf gun that jams much less. My son was very excited when he got it, but within 10 minutes he was extremely disappointed with this toy because of the jamming. Returning the product to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: BKM

customer_reviews.title: Safe Toy that offers entertainment for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy as a gift for my Grandson on his seventh birthday. He absolutely loved it and played with it all day. It’s well made and tough enough to survive a seven year old’s rough play. The darts are soft and shoot a long way. I would definitely recommend this toy for boys or girls who enjoy playing army.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Wancik

customer_reviews.title: We have so much fun with them
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my husband and I. We have so much fun with them. The first night we just had an outright war, and we also use it to settle disputes such as who will cook dinner or whatever. We set up 5 items in a row and whoever shoots 3 of those off a shelf doesn't have to. Overall, very fun- you don't have to be a kid to enjoy it. I would recommend getting extra darts since each gun only comes with six.
customer_reviews.author: maria carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Maybe mine was defective?
customer_reviews.text: First, the darts stopped staying in the gun after only a couple weeks of use. I noticed this with another Elite gun but not with another line of Nerf guns that my kid has. It seems like these blue darts don't work as well as other colored darts. Next, the gun started misfiring almost always. This happens with both sets of darts we own — the blue ones that came with the gun and some yellow ones from another set of guns.
customer_reviews.author: zwerd328

customer_reviews.title: Gun was awesome. Only issue I bought two guns and one ...
customer_reviews.text: Gun was awesome. Only issue I bought two guns and one of they came with Nerf Bullets. The other one came with other brand bullets. The gun shoots the nerf brand bullets no problem. The other brand bullets are droopy when you shoot them. Make sure you send nerf brand bullets please.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nerf, the toy I never had
customer_reviews.text: Ask my coworkers! I'm old enough that Nerf means(meant) haha you can't hit me and even if you do I will barely know it. But this is 21st century Nerf, the haha is what I say as I hit someone almost exactly where I wanted and with enough force they know it. Nerf, you are geniuses making fun, safe toys. But be mindful that though this is a toy, a gun isn't. Know the difference, understand the difference and be the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Seth.H

customer_reviews.title: Great Nurf gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little Nerf Gun. It can fire rapidly and does not need batteries!!! It has survived may battles and is still shooting like a champ. The only issue is that it jams once in a while.... my son likes this as he gets in some free shots. I recommend this one but also suggest getting a lot of spare Nerf darts as fly very far.
customer_reviews.author: DCLW

customer_reviews.title: Got this on a crazy good sale as a Christmas present.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one and a larger red one as Christmas gifts. The sale prices were just to good to pass up. The colors were chosen that that each child would know whose was whose. This one is much smaller than the red one but is a standard nerf offering. Each to use, fun for all ages. And at the price was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Tivo Man

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun, not-too-expensive nerf gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun, not-too-expensive nerf gun. My son loves that it's "automatic" and he can shoot several darts without stopping to reload. It functions well and despite being left outside for long periods of time, has never had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: JosieF

customer_reviews.title: Power Plus for a Nerf Shooter
customer_reviews.text: Because this Nerf gun is a pump action it has a lot more power on each shot than any battery powered gun. I’m going to store it for a few years until my grandkids are old. Eye protection is a must. A fun, high quality Nerf shooter.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho resident

customer_reviews.title: No need to replace the air restrictor because that will actually make it perform not as good and screw up the functionality
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about the strong arm the most efficient Nerf gun on the market. No need to replace the air restrictor because that will actually make it perform not as good and screw up the functionality. With this gun all I need to do is stretch the spring out that comes with it or replace the spring you will get 120 ft or more on an angle! Nothing beats a modified Strongarm!!
customer_reviews.author: rocco

customer_reviews.title: Great little gift!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loved this gun. I believe he has every nerf gun made and he said this one shoots stronger than most. We were able to use a generic refill for the bullets so he could have lots more since he tends to lose them. Overall a great purchase and gift for a 10 yr old boy.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Fruge

customer_reviews.title: I usually LOVE Nerf products
customer_reviews.text: I usually LOVE Nerf products.. with 8 grandchildren we have just about all the guns u can get unfortunately this one is NOT one of our favorites.. even my 8yr old grandson can't pull the trigger on it.. probably be good for teens but definitely not for younger kids.. the darts that came w the gun fell apart after shooting them against the wall a CPL times thank goodness I bought refills.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Snyder

customer_reviews.title: This nerf gun packs some power! Medium sized but shoots like the big guys
customer_reviews.text: It's a nerf fun, what's not to like! Great fun indeed. This medium sized gun packs some power! It actually stings a little if your hit on the bare skin at close range so I wouldn't recommend it for little tykes. It arrived fast and was packaged well. We bought this gun to chase away an evil bully cat that comes into my yard to harass my scared, young kitty. Received the gun but the evil cat must be in hiding because all of the sudden he quit coming around ( somebody must have tipped him off!) In the mean time we are having a lot of fun hitting trash cans, Coke cans, you name it!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: As gife not bad..
customer_reviews.text: it broke in few months, I can't put the thick back on the back, well my so like it for he's birtherday gife. Accuracy not 100% maybe 85% well depending how far... Well kid toy, you don't want too powerful. It hurt you...
customer_reviews.author: Irongohon

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive dart gun
customer_reviews.text: Very nice toy dart gun. I have it to our Angel Tree child at Christmas. The only negative was that the toy came in a plain brown box, not the normal Nerf package you would get if you bought it in a store.
customer_reviews.author: LindsB

customer_reviews.title: Fun Nerf Blaster
customer_reviews.text: My son and husband were super stoked to get these for Christmas this year. There have been numerous nerf battles since. It is easy to fire and reload, even for younger players. Definitely recommend purchasing a lot more darts....they are easy to lose especially in the midst of battle!
customer_reviews.author: RiverSong

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful; Neat loading feature
customer_reviews.text: My just turned 6 year really liked this Nerf gun. The loaded feature is fun - the barrel disengages and can be spun to load. The loading, cocking, and triggers are all to tricky for my 3 year old to manage on his own but the 6 year old can use it independently. The bullets shoot out very fast and I feel like these could really hurt if you were hit at close range.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Barely shoots after only a couple of uses
customer_reviews.text: After the first use the spring would only shoot the dart out a few feet (like it's just falling out of the barrel of the gun), about once every 6 shots. I figured one dud per 6 shots wasn't the end of the world so we kept using it. Now you have to reload it 2 or 3 times before you ever get one that isn't a dud. That's 20 or so duds for every one or two good shots. Useless now. We weren't rough on it or anything either. This was just with adults using it.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Taneyhill

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I made a mistake and bought a nerf gun vest with all the cool pieces and extra ammo but there was no gun! I found this gun that went with the set and ordered it quickly. I was a little worried since the price was so low but when it got here and we used it...... I’m so thankful we found it. The power this little nerf gun has is awesome!! My 7 1/2 year old son LOVES it and eve my 4 year old daughter was able to use it. I will be buying a second one for her!!! Definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 6 altogether
customer_reviews.text: Our son had a nerf war party for his 9th birthday back in October and we bought 6 of these for his friends to use. We didn’t have issues with any of them and they’re still used regularly!
customer_reviews.author: CGK

customer_reviews.title: If you thrive off of chaos, buy one.....or three. :)
customer_reviews.text: Easily one of the best things I have ever purchased. Got one to bring chaos to the workplace and then purchased one for a co worker to increase the workplace chaos. It has made going into work so much better now anytime I walk into the office I get shot and shoot in return. 10 out of 10 would reccomend, just don't let customers see you it has almost ended badly too many times. In conclusion if you are someone like myself who thrives off of chaos buy a few a these and go wild, it will bring joy to your life.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: These are nice nerf guns
customer_reviews.text: These are nice nerf guns, but they sting when they hit. I read a lot of these reviews before purchasing for our four year old and I thought they would be ok (I ordered three). If ordered for small children, I recommend safety glasses! Shoot, I recommend safety glasss for the adults too! These are way more powerful then I though. It left a red mark on my neck, when my son accidentally hit me. I would say at least 6 and up.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Its more cool due to the slide out loading however i find ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought Nerf N-Strike Elite Strongarm Blaster along with Nerf N-Strike Elite Disruptor, while I prefer the Disruptor my son likes the Strongarm. Its more cool due to the slide out loading however i find that inconvenient compared to the Disruptor. Overall both are good but Disruptor being new feels more robust.
customer_reviews.author: Technocrat

product_meta.title: Nerf N Strike Elite Strongarm Toy Blaster with Rotating Barrel, Slam Fire, and 6 Official Nerf Elite Darts for Kids, Teens, & Adults(Amazon Exclusive)
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Frustration-Free PackagingFire 6 darts in a row from the quick draw, fast firing Nerf Strongam blaster! When speed and mobility are essential, bring this N Strike Elite toy blaster into Nerf battles. Take aim at targets with this blaster that shoots darts up to 90 feet (27 meters) away. The barrel flips open to the side of the blaster for easy loading and holds up to 6 Nerf Elite darts, so you can fire 6 darts before it’s time to reload. The Strongarm Nerf blaster has slam fire action to rapid fire all 6 darts in a fast, frenzied wave of foam! It comes with 6 Official Nerf Elite darts that are designed for distance, tested and approved for performance and quality, and constructed of foam with flexible, hollow tips. You’re in control of the action as you move the slide to prime the blaster and pull the trigger to fire. No batteries required. It’s a great gift for Nerf newbies and a cool blaster for Nerf fans to add to their collection! Nerf and all related properties are trademarks of Hasbro. Motorized Speed Load Technology automatically loads darts into the drum

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Speed and mobility are yours with the quick draws and fast firing of the Strongarm blaster. It has the same long-range power as other N-Strike Elite blasters (sold separately) and it rapid-fires 6 darts when you pump the Slam Fire slide repeatedly while holding the trigger. Loading is easy and quick with the flip-open rotating barrel and its Tactical Rail is compatible with most N-Strike accessories (sold separately). Add the Strong arm blaster to your arsenal and unleash a storm of darts at your target.
feature_bullets: FIRE 6 DARTS IN A ROW: Fire 6 darts in a row from this quick draw, fast firing Nerf N Strike Elite Strongarm toy blaster that shoots darts up to 90 feet (27 meters) and includes 6 Nerf Elite darts
SLAM FIRE BLASTING: Slam fire all 6 darts in a rapid blasting wave at targets by moving the slide back and forth as you hold down the trigger
INCLUDES 6 NERF DARTS: Includes 6 Official Nerf Elite darts that are designed for distance, tested and approved for performance and quality and constructed of foam with flexible, hollow tips
EASY OPEN, RECYCLABLE PACKAGE: Ships in simple recyclable packaging that’s easy to open and frustration free
FLIP OPEN ROTATING 6 DART BARREL: The Strongarm Nerf blaster has a rotating 6 dart barrel that flips open for easy dart loading and is hand powered no batteries required

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars11,702 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
